newsitem.title: USA: Fulton Cty, Ga., has $93 million surplus for 1996.
newsitem.headline: Fulton Cty, Ga., has $93 million surplus for 1996.

text.p: Georgia's Fulton County ended 1996 with a surplus of $93 million, Atlanta Journal-Constitution reported Wednesday.
The county will put $38 million into an emergency cash reserve fund, and vote by next week on how to allocate the remaining $55 million.
County Commisison Chairman Mitch Skandalakis has proposed using most of the money for long-postponed construction of libraries, parks and senior citizens centers.
The county, which had an operating budget of $486 million for the year, has seen dramatic improvement in its financial picture.
In 1955, Fulton did not fund any capital improvements and was forced to draw $23 million from reserves to balance its budget.
